title: I want a book on how to create type.
content:
Can anyone recommend me a book on how to creat a type? I’ve been looking for it for such a long time. It is NOT a book to teach me how to use Fontographer, not a book to teach me how to lettering; BUT a book containing wisdom and experience of the precursors in the type history, a book containing detailed materials of how curves and edges have been made in that way.

Books can be found on Amazon or United States would be preffered. Thanks a lot.

 [‹ What should I pair with Gill?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203009/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14333 "Go to previous forum topic") [Searching for graphic designers in Chisinau / Moldavia ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203009/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14401 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Z.Y.L

comments.content: You should buy [Learn FontLab Fast](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203009/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0965762858/qid=1123198020/sr=8-5/ref=pd_bbs_sbs_5/104-4164666-2031163?v=glance&s=books&n=507846) and [Logo Font & Lettering Bible](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203009/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/1581804369/ref=pd_bxgy_img_2/104-4164666-2031163?v=glance&s=books&n=507846) both written by Leslie Cabarga

Alex, here’s a good online primer from Underware:  
 [http://www.typeworkshop.com/index.php?id1=type-basics](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203009/http:/www.typeworkshop.com/index.php?id1=type-basics "http://www.typeworkshop.com/index.php?id1=type-basics")

Also reproduced in their “5 pts” book.
Thanks for all the resourses you guys have shown me.
[TypeCulture.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080113203009/http:/www.typeculture.com/academic_resource/) has a lot to offer as well.
